intro: Palicourea juruana, commonly known as the Amazonian moon vine, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that turn red when mature. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used by indigenous communities for various health purposes.
